spanishExample: Tu honor no va a significar nada si les haces daño.
englishTranslation: Your honor is not going to mean anything if you hurt them.
vocabIncluded: les: "them" as an indirect object ("to them", "for them")
using Ir and "a" to put verbs in the future (e.g. "voy a ser")

spanishExample: ¡Por favor, discúlpenme!
englishTranslation: (plural) Please, forgive me!
vocabIncluded: discúlpenme: excuse me / forgive me (Disculpar, plural imperative contraction)

spanishExample: Además de todo eso, ella quiere que la ayude.
englishTranslation: Besides all of that, she wants me to help her.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
ayude: help, I help (Ayudar, subjunctive, 1st person)

spanishExample: Disculpe, quiero decirle que fue un placer hablar con usted.
englishTranslation: (formal) Excuse me, I want to tell you it was a pleasure to talk to you.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
hablar: to speak / to talk (Hablar infinitive)
usted: formal "you" after a preposition (prep. pronoun)

spanishExample: Quiere que lo disculpe porque sabe que no voy a ayudarlo.
englishTranslation: He wants me to forgive him because he knows I’m not going to help him.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
ayudarlo: to help him (Ayudar infinitive) + CONTRACTION
disculpe: forgive/excuse, I forgive/excuse (Disculpar, subjunctive, 1st person)
using Ir and "a" to put verbs in the future (e.g. "voy a ser")

spanishExample: Esas cosas no significan nada, pero han significado algo antes.
englishTranslation: Those things don’t mean anything, but they have meant something before.
vocabIncluded: han: "have", "they have" before a participle (Haber, present, 3rd person plural)
significan: mean, they mean (Significar, present, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: No sé qué sucede, pero lo hemos perdido alrededor de ese lugar.
englishTranslation: I don’t know what’s occurring, but we have lost it around that place.
vocabIncluded: "qué" in an implied question, not an actual question
alrededor: around (adverb often used with de)
hemos: "have", "we have" before a participle (Haber, present, 1st person plural)
sucede: occurs/happens, he/she/it occurs/happens (Suceder, present, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Es una pena que ustedes no puedan ir por mi culpa.
englishTranslation: It’s a pity you all can’t go because of my fault.
vocabIncluded: puedan: "be able", "they be able" (Poder, subjunctive, 3rd person plural)
ustedes: "you" plural, subject pronoun (3rd-person plural treatment)

spanishExample: Si como con ellos, voy a perder el tren.
englishTranslation: If I eat with them, I’m going to miss the train.
vocabIncluded: como: eat, I eat (Comer, present, 1st person)
using Ir and "a" to put verbs in the future (e.g. "voy a ser")

spanishExample: Quiero que él te ayude porque tienes mucho dolor.
englishTranslation: I want him to help you because you’re in a lot of pain.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
ayude: help, he/she/it help (Ayudar, subjunctive, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Lo que decía no significaba nada para nosotros.
englishTranslation: What he was saying didn’t mean anything to us.
vocabIncluded: "lo que": "what" as a connector between phrases
decía: "was saying", "he/she/it was saying" (Decir, imperfect, 3rd person)
significaba: meant, he/she/it meant (Significar, imperfect, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Quiero que se disculpe y que ellos también se disculpen.
englishTranslation: I want him to apologize and them also to apologize.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
disculparse: any use of forgive with a reflexive pronoun, changing the meaning to apologize)
disculpe: forgive/excuse, he/she/it forgive/excuse (Disculpar, subjunctive, 3rd person)
disculpen: forgive/excuse, they forgive/excuse (Disculpar, subjunctive, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: ¡Disculpa a tu amiga! Ella solo quería ayudarte.
englishTranslation: Forgive you friend (f)! She just wanted to help you.
vocabIncluded: "the personal a": using an extra "a" before a direct object when it's a person
ayudarte: to help you (Ayudar infinitive) + CONTRACTION

spanishExample: ¿Los vas a ayudar? Si no, van a perderse.
englishTranslation: Are you going to help them? If not, they are going to get lost.
vocabIncluded: perderse: any use of perder with a reflexive pronoun, changing the meaning to to get lost)
using Ir and "a" to put verbs in the future (e.g. "voy a ser")

spanishExample: Sé que no significa nada, pero igual ¿puedes ayudarme?
englishTranslation: I know it doesn't mean anything, but still, can you help me?
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
ayudarme: to help me(Ayudar infinitive) + CONTRACTION
significa: means, he/she/it means (Significar, present, 3rd person)

spanishExample: ¡Discúlpame! Lo que hice anoche estuvo mal.
englishTranslation: Forgive me! What I did last night was wrong.
vocabIncluded: "lo que": "what" as a connector between phrases

spanishExample: Simplemente no quiero comer, así que ayúdame a hacer eso.
englishTranslation: I simply don’t want to eat, so help me do that.
vocabIncluded: a: complement (e.g. ayudar a, empezar a) (preposition)

spanishExample: ¿Por qué no te disculpas si él siempre te ayuda?
englishTranslation: Why don’t you apologize if he always helps you?
vocabIncluded: ayuda: helps, he/she/it helps (Ayudar, present, 3rd person)
disculparse: any use of forgive with a reflexive pronoun, changing the meaning to apologize)
disculpas: forgive/excuse, you forgive/excuse (Disculpar, present, 2nd person)

spanishExample: ¡Ayuda a esas personas! Está claro que no pueden hacerlo.
englishTranslation: Help those people! It’s clear they can’t do it.
vocabIncluded: a: complement (e.g. ayudar a, empezar a) (preposition)
claro: adjective meaning "clear" when used with Estar

spanishExample: No quiero disculparme y por eso ella no me disculpa.
englishTranslation: I don’t want to apologize and that’s why she doesn't forgive me.
vocabIncluded: disculpa: forgives/excuses, he/she/it forgives/excuses (Disculpar, present, 3rd person)
disculparme: to forgive me (Disculpar infinitive) + CONTRACTION
